variable_definition: The author should be contacted with any further questions.
The author should not be contacted with any further questions.
Journal article.
Book.
Master's Thesis.
Miscellaneous publications such as online datasets.
PhD thesis or dissertation.
Technical report.
Unpublished source.
A half cylinder coring device in which the coring section is open, not sealed off by a fin.
A large diameter (>10 cm) coring device consisting of a tube, piston, and a cutting head.
A half cylinder coring device with the coring section sealed off by a fin attached to a rotating pivot point.
U-shaped blade that extracts a core by cutting down through peat.
No coring device was specified.
Any other type of coring device typically taking cores shallower than 30 centimeters.
A device that extrudes core into tube upward with a plunger.
Any number of coring types involving driving a tube into the sediment to recover a core.
PVC pipe was driven into the sediment with a hammer to recover a core.
A half cylinder coring device with the coring section sealed off by a fin attached to a rotating pivot point.
A technique involving collecting a core by sinking a continuous pipe into sediment attaching a source of vibration, then recovering using a winch and pulley.
A technique involving collecting a core shallower than ~5 cm using a circular metal cutter.
Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements.
Roots and rhizomes were separated from soil before dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements.
Sediment was sieved prior to analysis for organics.
Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.
Compaction was at least qualified and noted by the authors.
Compaction was quantified and corrected for in core based measurements.
Authors specified that the coring device's design minimized compaction.
Authors observed no obvious compaction.
Compaction was not specified.
Methodology specified that samples were air dried to a constant mass.
Bulk density was not measured, but was modeled from loss on ignition and assumptions about the particle densities of organic and inorganic matter.
Bulk density was measured on freeze dried samples.
No additional details regarding bulk density methodology were provided.
Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that non-strucural water was removed.
Bulk density time recorded herin is an approximate estimate.
Bulk density time was not specified.
Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass.
No additional details regarding loss on ignition methodology were provided.
Loss on ignition time recorded herin is an approximate estimate.
No additional details regarding loss on ignition duration were provided.
Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled.
Fraction carbon was modeled as opposed to measured.
Carbonates were not removed before measuring organic carbon.
Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.
Carbonates were removed using direct application of dilute acid.
Carbonates were removed by fumigating with concentrated acid.
Organic carbon fraction were measured without removing carbonates assuming carbonate content of the soil type was minimal.
Carbonates were not removed and low carbonate soil was not specified.
Carbonate removal methodology was not specified.
A regression model fit using a subset of measurements was used to predict fraction carbon as a funciton of fraction organic matter.
Used regression model from Craft et al., 1991, Estuaries, to predict fraction carbon as a funciton of fraction organic matter.
Used regression model from Holmquist et al., 2018, Scientific Reports, to predict fraction carbon as a funciton of fraction organic matter.
Each sample presented was measured using Elemantal Analysis.
Used regression model from Fourqurean et al., 2012, Nature Geoscience, to predict fraction carbon as a funciton of fraction organic matter.
Each sample was measured using a wet oxidation method.
Each sample was measured kjeldahl digestion method.
No additional detals were provided regarding fraction carbon methodologies.
Alpha counting method used.
Gamma counting method used.
Alpha counting method used.
Gamma counting method used.
Excess <sup>210</sup>Pb modeled using mass accumulation rate.
Excess <sup>210</sup>Pb modeled using vertical accretion rate.
Constant rate of supply model used.
Constant initial concentration model used.
Constant flux constant sedimentation model used.
<sup>226</sup>Ra was measured for each sample.
<sup>226</sup>Ra was measured for the total core,
<sup>226</sup>Ra at the core's <sup>210</sup>Pb activity to depth assymptote was assumed to be the background level of the core.
Accelerator mass spectroscopy used.
Beta counting used.
Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon.
Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of total carbon.
Year zero is defined as years before present, 1960 CE.
Year zero is set according to Common Era and Before Common Era standards.
Year zero is set as the core's collection year.
5-35 parts per thousand salinity (ppt) according to the coastal change analysis program.
< 5 ppt according to the coastal change analysis program.
0.5-35 ppt according to most other definitions.
< 0.5 ppt according to most other definitions.
>50 ppt.
Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation.
Salinity observed from local instrument.
Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants.
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation <= 5 meters in height.
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation > 5 meters in height.
Dominated by forested to scrub/shrub biomass.
Describes tidal or subtidal communities dominated by rooted vascular plants.
Vegetation inferred by field observation.
Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type.
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type.

Study-specific definition of a relatively low elevation zone behind a levee.

Inundation class assesed from elevation and nearby tidegauge or other similar method.
Real-time kinematic global position system (GPS).
Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS.
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 1 meter.
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 30 meters.
Any other technique resulting in positional error > 30 meters.

variable_name: core depth limited by length of corer
variable_definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device.
Authors report that the depth of the core represents the depth of the wetland soil deposit.
Authors did not specify whether or not the depth of the core represents the depth of the wetland soil deposit.
Horizon was added to the surface artificially by using materials such as feldspar, glitter, or rare earth elements.
Pollen analysis was used to tie horizon to the timing of vegetation change such as the arrival of invasives, or the beginning of local agriculture.
Chemical analysis was used to tie the horizon to the timing of a pollution event.
Sediment analysis was used to tie the horizon to the timing of a tsunami event.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Tidal flow is muted or blocked by built structures.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Water level is raised artificially by a tidal restriction, resulting in ponding of water on the wetland and or upland surface.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Wetland is impounded seasonally, and other times natural or semi natural hydrology occurs.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Tidal hydrology is altered because artificial ditches have been cut to promote tidal flooding and drainage.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: The wetland has been diked and drained, with or without flapper gates, pumping, or other means.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Managed impoundment or drainage in which wetland has been converted to agricultural land.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Tidal flow has been restored by removing an artificial obstruction.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Wetland vegetation has been reintroduced by replanting on unvegetated surfaces.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Natural plant communities have been restored by the active removal of invasive plant species.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Tidal wetland vegetation has been managed by the removal of invasive herbivores.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Elevation has been managed by artificially adding sediment to the site using techniques such as thin layering or sediment diversion.

table: l impact at site or subsite
variable_definition: Constructed wetland using sediments such as dredge spoils or other sediment source.
